results.title: The Awakening
results.creator_credit: Millbank Films, Lloyds Bank, Peter Griffiths and Ron Tanner
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Starting your own business”.
This is the second film in the series, Starting Your Own Business. The film continues the story of the three people who are self-employed, and it traces the first year in business for each of the characters. Again the problems and pitfalls involved in going it alone are identified and the audience can see the reasons why two of the businesses fail.

results.title: The Aviators of Hudson Strait
results.brief_description: A look at early Canadian aviation, through film footage shot by the Royal Canadian Air Force and the recollections of retired Air Vice-Marshal Thomas A. Lawrence, leader of the 1927-28 aerial survey expedition to Ungava Bay and Hudson Strait. The formidable challenge of flying under Arctic conditions, the hazards faced and the emergencies solved, often with the help of Inuit, make an absorbing chapter of northern frontier history. Written by William Weintraub.

results.title: The Avengers. Vol. 01
results.brief_description: They were sauve, sophisticated and dangerous. Patrick Macnee and Diana Rigg, as Steed and Emma Peel delighted audiences worldwide in the sixties espionage thriller “The Avengers.” Two episodes are featured. “The Town of no return” shot in black and white in 1965, sees four agents disappear from a small remote village on the Norfolk coast and Steed and Peel are called upon to solve the case. “From Venus with love”, shot in colour in 1966, sees Steed and Peel in their own version of the “X-files” as astronomers are dying with their hair bleached white by an unknown killer.

results.title: The Autonomic nervous system
results.brief_description: Extraordinary photographs of living organs shows the autonomic nervous system controlling involuntary body processes such as breathing, heart rate, blood pressure and digestion. Animation is used to illustrate the sympathetic and parasympathetic divisions of the autonomic nervous system and the part it is thought to play in the human emotions. No other credits available.

results.title: The Automated mariner
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation, Damien Parer and Roger Lupton
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how radar, sonar, and echosound are used to catch the variety of edible sealife found around the coast of Tasmania. Narrated by Frank Bansel, music performed by the Tasmanian Symphony Orchestra conducted by Pinchas Steinberg.

results.title: The Austrian Tyrol
results.brief_description: Famed for its natural beauty and alpine grandeur, the Austrian Tyrol has excellent mountain roads for enjoyable walks or mountain climbing. The film shows some of the villages including the 700 years old city of Innsbruck nestling below the vast mountains.
